forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 60. West wind 8 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

weather_report:
In downtown San Francisco, a soft veil of clouds hangs over the city as the chill of night gives way to a new day. Currently, the air is cool, around 50 degrees, with a gentle west wind brushing against the skin, carrying whispers of distant waves. As morning breaks, expect the overcast to lift, revealing glimpses of blue painted across the sky. By midday, the sun will shine brightly, illuminating the vibrant streets as temperatures rise to a comfortable 60 degrees. The west wind will pick up slightly, adding a refreshing zest to the atmosphere, ideal for a pleasant stroll through the city.

The morning is crisp, with hints of a marine layer clinging to the edges of the bay, but it won’t linger long. By midday, you may notice the fog retreating, revealing the iconic skyline and the majestic Golden Gate, standing proud against the clarity of a sunlit day. Dress comfortably in layers—perhaps a light sweater or jacket to usher you through the cool morning, transitioning to a breathable shirt as the warmth of the day envelops you. With these conditions, it’s a perfect opportunity to enjoy a leisurely breakfast at a local café, savoring the scents of fresh brews. As you look out over the city, consider spending your afternoon exploring hidden parks or wandering along the waterfront, delighting in all that this beautiful day has to offer.
